title: CBL2: Sciatic Nerve Injury and Common Peroneal Nerve Injury

questions.question: 1. Which nerve is the largest in the human body?
2. The sciatic nerve typically divides into which two terminal branches?
options: Tibial nerve and common peroneal nerve

questions.question: 3. Common peroneal nerve injury often results in which clinical condition?
4. Sciatic nerve injury can lead to deficits in which regions?
5. Which anatomical structure predisposes the common peroneal nerve to injury at the knee?
6. Which of the following is a common cause of traumatic sciatic nerve injury?
7. Sciatic nerve injury may result in loss of function in which muscle groups?
options: Hamstrings and all muscles below the knee

questions.question: 8. Which clinical sign is most characteristic of a common peroneal nerve injury?
9. Damage to the common peroneal nerve may lead to sensory loss over which area?
options: Dorsum of the foot and lateral aspect of the leg

questions.question: 10. Which nerve is most susceptible to compression injuries due to its superficial course?
11. In a complete sciatic nerve injury, which deficit is most likely observed?
options: Loss of sensation in the entire lower leg and foot

questions.question: 12. The tibial nerve, a branch of the sciatic nerve, primarily supplies which functions?
options: Plantar flexion and inversion of the foot

questions.question: 13. What is the most common site of injury for the common peroneal nerve?
14. A potential long-term complication of untreated common peroneal nerve injury is:
15. Sciatica is characterized by which of the following symptoms?
options: Radiating pain from the buttock down the posterior thigh

questions.question: 16. Which imaging modality is most useful for assessing the extent of sciatic nerve injury?
17. Early intervention in sciatic nerve injury is important because:
options: It improves the chances of nerve regeneration
It reduces the risk of fractures
